Name: Ptolemies
History: The Ptolemaic dynasty was a Macedonian Greek royal family which ruled the Ptolemaic Empire in Egypt during the Hellenistic period. Their rule lasted for 275 years, from 305 BC to 30 BC. They were the last dynasty of ancient Egypt.

Factions.Name: Ptolemaic Egyptians
Factions.Description: The great Greek-Macedonian dynastic rule over Ancient Egypt.

Technologies.Name: Mercenary Army
Technologies.History: The Greco-Macedonian Ptolemy Dynasty relied on large numbers of Greek and foreign mercenaries for the bulk of its military force, mainly because the loyalty of native Egyptian units was often suspect. Indeed, during one native uprising, Upper Egypt was lost to the Ptolemies for decades. Mercenaries were often battle-hardened and their loyalty can be bought, sometimes cheaply, sometimes not cheaply. This was of no matter, since Egypt under the Ptolemies was so prosperous as to be the richest of Alexander's successor states.

Technologies.Name: Ptolemaic Garrisons
Technologies.History: The Ptolemies relied extensively on fortified garrisons to protect their overseas and distant possessions.

Technologies.Name: Machimoi Reforms
Technologies.History: In order to counter the Seleucid threat, the Ptolemies eventually started training Egyptians to fight as pikemen.

Technologies.Name: Romanization Reforms
Technologies.History: Late Ptolemaic Egypt switched it's pike army core to Roman influenced swordsmen trained by Roman mercenary instructors.

Heroes.Name: Machimos Phalangites
Heroes.History: Weak for a champion unit but costs no metal. Requires Machimoi Reform.

CivBonuses.Name: Cult Of Isis.
CivBonuses.History: The Macedonian-Greek rulers of the Ptolemaic dynasty observed many ancient Egyptian traditions in order to satiate the local populace and ingratiate themselves to the powerful priestly class in the country.
CivBonuses.Description: Temple technologies -50% cost and research time.

CivBonuses.Name: Nile Delta
CivBonuses.History: The Nile Delta had rich soil for farming, due to centuries of seasonal floods from the Nile depositing rich silt across the landscape.

CivBonuses.Name: Clay Structures
CivBonuses.History: Clay construction provided cheap structures for the Egyptians.
CivBonuses.Description: Houses, Farmsteads, Storehouses and Corrals cost no resources but take longer to build.

CivBonuses.Name: Foreign Dynasty
CivBonuses.History: The Seleucids and Ptolemies chose military settlers as the core of their armies, as those troops were generally more loyal and less risky to train than conquered people.
CivBonuses.Description: Military barracks train strong units with many upgrades while Levy Barracks train levied subjects which are weaker, have less upgrades but are easier to mass produce.

TeamBonuses.Name: Centre Of Knowledge
TeamBonuses.History: Egypt was a net exporter of grain, so much so that large cities such as Athens, Antioch, and Rome came to rely upon Egyptian grain in order to feed their masses.
TeamBonuses.Description: Ships and Siege Units -10% resource cost (currently not shared).

Structures.Name: Lighthouse
Structures.History: The Ptolemaic dynasty in Egypt built the magnificent Lighthouse of Alexandria near the harbor mouth of that Nile Delta city. This structure could be seen for many kilometers out to sea and was one of the Seven Wonders of the World.
Structures.Description: Has a huge line of sight. Limit: 1.
